ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Misophonia
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Extreme emotional reactions (anger, rage) and physical discomfort to specific trigger sounds (chewing, eating); MAQ score 51 (Extreme) and A-MISO-S score 19 (Severe).

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hyperacusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Decreased loudness tolerance with LDLs between 60 and 80 dB HL; patient reports physical discomfort to sounds.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To evaluate loudness tolerance and screen for hyperacusis.
To quantify the severity and impact of misophonia and sound sensitivity (MAQ, A-MISO-S).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrated normal peripheral hearing sensitivity and middle ear function bilaterally. However, results indicated significant hyperacusis (reduced LDLs) and extreme misophonia (high scores on MAQ and A-MISO-S), with severe negative impact on daily life including self-mutilating behaviors.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally with PTA of 12 dB HL in each ear (250-20,000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT 10 dB HL AU; WRS 96% (Right) and 100% (Left) at 50 dB HL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal middle ear function (Type A) bilaterally.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Could not test (CNT) due to patient's extreme sound hypersensitivity.

tests.name: Loudness Discomfort Levels (LDL)
tests.result_summary: Reduced loudness tolerance; LDLs 60-80 dB HL for pure tones and 75 dB HL for speech.

tests.name: Self-Report Scales
tests.result_summary: MAQ score 51 (Extreme); A-MISO-S score 19 (Severe); Subjective annoyance 10/10.

proposed_items: Fit with bilateral Resound LINX2 5 receiver-in-the-canal (RIC) hearing aids programmed with 'water creek' sound therapy.
Systematic program of sound therapy with gradual increase in exposure.
Referral to psychologist or psychiatrist for evaluation and intervention.
counseling_actions: Counseling on the nature of misophonia and hyperacusis.
Instruction on using sound therapy devices (increase volume when bothered, decrease when less bothered) to build tolerance.
Recommendation for mental health intervention due to self-harm and obsessive behaviors.
Discussion of challenges related to college transition and communal living.

escalation.rationale_short: Patient exhibits self-mutilating behaviors (digging fingernails into hands/wrists) and extreme rage in response to sounds.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds, loudness discomfort levels, and misophonia severity via questionnaires.

expected_outcome: Pure-tone audiometry (1-year follow-up): Thresholds at 250 to 20,000 Hz revealed no change in pure-tone air conduction thresholds compared to baseline.
Loudness Discomfort Levels (1-year follow-up): Markedly decreased to levels between 35 and 50 dB HL in each ear, indicating worsened sound tolerance.
Misophonia Assessment Questionnaire (MAQ) (1-year follow-up): Total score of 60, placing patient in the extreme misophonia category.
Amsterdam Misophonia Scale (A-MISO-S) (1-year follow-up): Total score of 21, placing patient in the extreme misophonia category.
Patient was not consistently utilizing sound therapy and showed no measurable improvement in managing sound sensitivities.
Patient was visibly distressed during the evaluation, unable to tolerate the waiting room, and communicated only by text message.
